intro: Dendropanax caloneurus, commonly known as the silver tree, is a unique species native to the island of New Guinea. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which results from dense, overlapping scales on its leaves. The plant is a member of the Araliaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical environments. Its growth habit includes a tall, slender trunk with a crown of broad, leathery leaves. Dendropanax caloneurus is also notable for its unusual reproductive structures, which include small, clustered flowers and berries.
